Text:
I wonder if Mitsugoshi is angry that our imitations
are a big success...
Are you worried about that, Kana?

Yes. Of course, if it comes to war, we have Lady
Yukime, but...

I'd still prefer not to get involved in unnecessary
conflicts. I hope Mitsugoshi doesn't get upset.
I'm sure they are already upset.
Wha...?

But given the current state of affairs, they won't
interfere with us. Why? Because this is the Lawless
City— my territory.
Is that how it works?

That's how it works. The Snow Fox Corporation's
influence only reaches as far as the City's border.

It would be a completely different matter if we sold
in Midgar Kingdom—Mitsugoshi's own territory...

Mitsugoshi has never really put much effort into
selling in the Lawless City.

Earn clean money in clean places. No doubt, that's
the correct way to do it.

I see... That's a relief to know, but it doesn't
exactly sit well with me.

It implies we're doing something dirty. I mean, sure,
we don't exactly run a clean business to begin with,
but...

Now, now, no need to get so worked up. Where there's
light, there are always shadows, after all.

If Mitsugoshi is the light, then Snow Fox Corporation
is its shadow... Think of it as a natural divide.

Besides, I have no intention of expanding our
territory any further.
You don't?

I assumed once we unified the Lawless City, we would
use that momentum to expand beyond it.

Well, yes...I do want to unify the Lawless City, but
I need to start by making the women here happy.

When I degraded myself to this place, things were
much worse than they are now.
Degraded...yourself...?

Yes, this is a city where women with nowhere else to
turn end up... Both of you can relate to this, right?
...Yes.

I've seen countless women who couldn't even afford
decent clothing.

You need a proper kimono, even just to pour drinks
for customers.

Without money to afford a replacement, they cover up
the smell with perfume.

I never knew you also experienced such hardship,
Lady Yukime.

I want to make things a bit easier for the girls here
today.

Of course, I don't mind the growing trend of working
hard to purchase high-quality kimono...

But until then, I hope they use Snow Fox
Corporation's affordable kimono.

If I can provide even a little joy and happiness in
their lives...

That's why Snow Fox Corporation always thinks of
thewomen living in the Lawless City, and we will
continue to make products for them.
Even if they're imitations...
Lady Yukime...
*sob* Oh, Lady Yukime! I'm so moved!
No need to cry... You always get so emotional, Natsu.

It's a virtue, but I worry about how you'll fare in a
city like this.
I-I'm sorry. I'll stop crying now...

Heheh. Here, take this towel. You can wipe your face
with it.

(...Thinking to when I'd lost everything, who
would've thought I'd become who I am today?)

(Back then, I really felt like I'd lost it all...
as if the world had ended...)

(Surprisingly, the future didn't turn out so bad
after all... Of course, I still haven't achieved my
goals yet...)

First, we need to defeat the Black and Red Towers and
unify the Lawless City!

That's right. The Red Tower has historically
represented the vampires...

The Black Tower represents raw physical power, and
we, the White Tower, represent financial power. It's
a precarious stalemate for all three towers.

I want to weaponize our influence as a company to
tilt the balance in our favor.

(And if I can control the entire Lawless City,
I should be able to gather intel on him...)

(I'll find the man who killed my mother and betrayed
me, and deliver his final judgment...)

(But that is my personal grudge... Natsu and Kana
have nothing to do with it, so I'll keep it to
myself.)
Lady Yukime... Is something troubling you?
Hm? Was it that obvious?

No, I just thought I saw a shadow pass across your
face...

(That took me by surprise... These girls are really
growing up.)

(Reading people's hearts and emotions... That's an
essential skill for surviving in this city...)

Oh, it's nothing. Just making sure not to get ahead
of ourselves.
First, we will unify the Lawless City. To that end...
To that end...?
First, we must feast.
Huh?

It's not a joke. I'm being serious. We've earned
enough profits to throw a banquet.
Well, that's true, but...

We'll invite all the women living in the red-light
district and present it as a celebration.

(I'll save the reminiscing for when this is all
over.)
(Now isn't that time. I have to look forward.)
